dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top shot of small town Bareilly. It’s early winter. Little fog. Smoke in a few places.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT.BITTI HOUSE
dialogues.text: Camera crosses empty terraces and moves inside a room to stop over a girl sleeping with her face covered with bedsheet. Camera travels back from the bedsheet covered girl to the woman in the courtyard on ground floor. We see top angle shot of a woman praying around a Tulsi plant. It is placed next to the prayer room.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BITTI COURTYARD —- CONTINUOUS 3 Mother, around 45 years old, is praying around the Tulsi plant, ringing the bell, already bathed. Father, around 50 years old, walks out of a room ina sweater and pyjama, looking a bit sleepy.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Susheela, O Susheela. Arre hamaari cigarette dekhi hai kya? Mother makes her eyes bigger and rings the bell louder to indicate that she is praying. Father shows her an empty cigarette packet.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Arre kal raat isme ek baaki thi. Mother continues to pray. Father looks hassled.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Iske bina subah utarti bhi toh nahi hai. Mother makes a face as she prays. Father requests her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arre Pilibhit/Bijauria jaana hai mithai deliver karne. Bina fresh hue nikle aur raaste mein aa gayi toh gajab ho jaayega. Mother makes a face and requests heavens to pardon her husband as she continues to pray.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Itni subah kahin milegi bhi nahi. Bitti se maang ke laa do na. Mother looks scandalized and finishes her prayer quickly.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: (irritated, surprised) Bitti ke paas kahaan se aayegi cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Arre wohh peeti hai. Mother is scandalized as she looks at the father suspiciously. c/u of Father nods to indicate that it's the truth.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maang lo bhai, urgent hai. Cut to Mother grumbles as she moves towards terrace.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Bas ek cigarette ki kami reh gayi thi laundiya mein. Cut to Father taunts from behind.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Kuch din aur ruk jaao, desi daru bhi milegi uske paas. INT. BITTI ROOM — CONTINUOUS 4 Mother walks up to a girl sleeping with her face covered with rajaai. She shakes her and tries to wake her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitti, ai Bitti. Bitti replies without getting up.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Kya kar rahe ho jaanu. Mother pulls the bedsheet.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Jaanu ki bachchi!!! Cut to Bitti’s face as she struggles to opens her eyes and see her mother in daylight. She is a young girl around 28.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Kya ma, kitna achcha sapna dekh rahi thi.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Tu bas sapne hee dekhti reh. Bitti goes back to sleep. Mother shakes her. She cringes and opens her eyes again.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Kya hai?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: (HESITANTLY) Sunn, tere paas cigarette hai? Bitti opens her eyes wide as she sits up.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Hainnn!!! Tu kab se cigarette peene lagi?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Jyaada bann matt. Cigarette hai? Tere papa ko chahiye.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Arre hum nahi peete hain. Mother looks at her suspiciously as she picks the empty water bottle kept next and pulls the clothes scattered. (doing some cleaning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nahi peete hain bhai. Laga lo sau sau ki.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Dekh tere saath behas karne ka time nahi hai hamaare paas. Papa ko Unnav jaana hai, ho nahi rahi hai. cut to Bitti sighs as she struggles to get up from the bed and stand to see mom has walked out. C/u of Bitti still half asleep, lazily sleeps back in shishuaasan.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: (in the pose) Laate hain kahin se maang ke.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BITTI COURTYARD —- CONTINUOUS 5 Bitti is walking down. Father sitting and standing again (impatient) sees her coming down and going out.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: (Screaming) Hame pata hai tumhee ne chura ke pee hai. Bitti walking towards the door. C/u of wearing her father’s bathroom slippers with socks. Wide shot of Bitti not even looking at him as she walks out.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Thoda aur jor laga ke chilla lo, apne aap ho jaayegi.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. BITTI LANE OUTSIDE HOUSE —- CONTINUOUS 6 Bitti is walking in the lane. A man is sitting outside his house and smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chacha, papa ko urgent hai.

dialogues.speaker: CHACHA
dialogues.text: Ek hee hai beta. Bitti takes the burning cigarette from him.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Chalegi. Thanks. Bitti walks away with the cigarette as the man watches. As she walks, she looks around and takes a few drags just outside her house door. C/u of her taking the drag, smoke flying in the cold alr. She closes the mansion gate which says "Mishra Sadan” Wide shot of her stepping inside the house.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BITTI COURTYARD —- CONTINUOUS 7 Bitti in the courtyard. It’s empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She climbs up to see her mother sitting beside the railing on a cane two seater chair with folded newspapers and peas kept on the cane table in front. She asks her mother who is peeling peas now.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Kahan hai papa? Mother with reading glasses moves her face towards one direction points towards the loo and make a face. Cut to Bitti walking toward the loo knocks on the door. C/u of Bitti’s ear close to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Hui?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Bitti puts the burning cigarette on a hole on the door.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Ye lo. Cut to the cigarette getting sucked inside in a flash. Cut to Bitti walking and sitting next to her mother on the cane sofa. She reaches out for the peeled peas. Mother hits her on her hand.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Haath dho ke aa.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Arre humne thodi na ke hain. Bitti looking at her irritated picks the bottle kept on the table and washes her hands on the rose pot behind.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Bitti wiping her hands with her mother’s pallu making a smiling quirky face.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Ye hain Bitti Mishra. cut to mother who is gives her a look.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Daughter of missej Susheela Mishra. Cut to loo door.  10

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And son of mister Narottam Mishra.

dialogues.speaker: FLUSH
dialogues.text: Bitti pops in a few peeled peas as mother nudges. C/u of Bitti looking at her to irritate more as she take the news paper to read.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ab unhone toh bete ki tarah hee paala hai na. INT. SCHOOL —- DAY 9 Bitti’s mother turns back to class after writing Myself on the board.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Susheela Mishra Narmada Primary school mein bachchon ko wohh sikhaati hain jo Bitti Mishra ne kabhi nahi seekha. Bitti’s mother turning towards the class.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Bachchon ko badon ki aagya ka... Kids looking at her and the board.

dialogues.speaker: KIDS
dialogues.text: Paalan karna chahiye!!!

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. SWEET SHOP
dialogues.text: A busy sweet shop and the name of the shop is written “lovla sweets” (Dont show signboard in the beginning else joke later will fall flat) C/u of Bitti’s father is attending to a customer at the sweet shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aur Narottam Mishra ki mithai se zyada meethi unki boli hai.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: (sweetly) Bhaisaab Shanno meri beti nahi hai? Ab uski shaadi mein mithai kam pad gayi toh aapki naak ke saath saath naak toh meri bhi kategi na (turns to attendant) paanch kilo aur taul de beta. Suddenly he sees a pulsar coming to a sudden halt in front of his shop and Bitti getting down, who was sitting like a boy. The rider looks like a chhapri. Bitti walks towards father.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ye kawwa kaun hai?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Kawwa nahi papa mor hai, aaj nahaaya nahi hoga.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Hai kaun?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Apne mohalle ka hee hai. Humne lift maangi, usne de di, humne kaha chhod do, usne chhod diya. Wohh chhodo sau rupai nikalo jaldi se.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Khud kamaati ho toh humse kyon Maangti ho?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Ye sweater hum apni kamaai se gift kiye the na? Laao do. Father puts hand inside his sweater and hesitantly takes out a hundred rupee note from his shirt pocket and gives her.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Ye lo.  11 12 13 Bitti tries to take the note and walk away but realizes that he is holding on to the note. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Beta dono pair ek side karke hee baitha kar bike pe. Bitti makes a ‘chatt’ sound from her mouth, grabs an imarti and walks out eating.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Bitti Mishra apni sharton pe jeeti hai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide shot of terrace landscape.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. BITTI’S TERRACE - EVENING 12 Bitti is smoking a cigarette, sitting with her friend Rama, against the boundary wall.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Chhup chhup ke cigarette peeti hai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C/u of food. Cut to Bitti and Rama are standing by a stall, holding their respective dishes. Bitti looks around and takes a bite from Rama’s plate and relishes it.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Ek baar dhoke se non-veg kha liya tha. Ab har mauke pe khaati hai.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 14 15 16 10. EXT. BITTI’S COLONY LANE - DAY 14 Wide shot of colony lane. Cut to Bitti standing slyly in one corner. One guy comes and hands her a pen drive.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Bitti Hollywood ki filmo ka shauk bhi rakhti hai.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: India mein release bhi nahi hui hai abhi. Bitti gives him a flying kiss. The guy smiles as if he has been paid back handsomely. EXT. RAMA’S BOUTIQUE - DAY 15 The boutique’s signboard reads “Forever 25” and aside there is a board which has “SUNDAY CLOSED” written on it. Another signboard on the side reads “Credit and Debit cards expected.”

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Jiska matinee show chalta hai Bitti ki best friend Rama ke boutique mein. INT. RAMA’S BOUTIQUE —- CONTINUOUS 16 Bitti and Rama are keenly watching the movie on a laptop.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Sixty percent samajh leti hai par hundred percent samjha deti hai.

dialogues.speaker: HERO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I want to break-up with you.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Main tumhe todna chahta hoon.

dialogues.speaker: HEROINE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?  11.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Pagla gaye ho kaa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide shot of Early Morning Bareilly City

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide shot of busy government office where Bitti is sitting on one of the desk. C/u of Bitti reading a novel on her desk.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Bitti bijli vibhaav ke shikayat department mein kaam karti hain. C/u Phone rings. Bitti picks it up and speaks without listening.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Poore shahar ki gayi hai. Thodi der mein aa jaayegi. Asuvidha ke liye khed hai.

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hamaare pados mein toh hai.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Unke yahaan invertor hai. Aap bhi lagwa leejiye. Aapka—din— shubh_ho Bitti cuts the phone. A-peon places_a_—cup of tea on the table he looks at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BITTT (cont Dy . : li ki .

dialogues.speaker: 19A
dialogues.text: 20 12. EXT. BITTI’S TERRACE —- EVENING 18 Bitti in home clothes is doing a break dance. Rama is sitting nearby. Other boys are watching her in awe from their respective terraces.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Bitti mohalle ki eklauti aisi ladki hai jo break dance kar leti hai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BITTI on scooter, wearing jacket enters the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old aunties dancing. Bitti is somewhere in between them Prelude to start her dance in a sangeet.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Isiliye mohalle ka koi bhi ladies sangeet is lady ke performance ke bina complete nahi hota. Bitti starts to dance. Song 1 - Credit titles start rolling.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BITTI’S ROOM - NIGHT 20 Bitti is taking off her jewelry after the sangeet, looking at her reflection sadly.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Par ek baat hai jo Bitti ki mummy ko din raat khaaye rehti hai. Mother taunts from outside.  21 13.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Jindagi bhar doosron ke sangeet mein hee naachiyo. Bitti hears what her mother has said. She continues to take off her jewelry sadly.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Bitti ka rishta hee pakka nahi ho pa raha hai. Do baar baat sagaai tak pahunchi, par toot gayi.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. BITTI’S TERRACE - NIGHT 21 Bitti is talking to her father. She is in a sombre mood.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Kya hua? Bitti keeps quiet. He shows her a cigarette asking her if she wants it.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hmmm? Bitti shakes her head in a no.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Beta tum ma ki baat ka bura mat Maana karo. Arre bahut pyaar karti hai tumko. Bitti nods understandingly.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Main ladka hoti toh sab sahi hota na? Koi kuch sawaal nahi karta. Cigarette peeta hai, bhai ladka hai. Der raat baahar ghoomta hai, ladke toh ghoomte hee hain. Jo muh mein aata hai bak deta hai, dil ka saaf hai. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BITTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do sagaai toot gayi toh kya, ab nahi pasand aayi toh nahi aayi, kisi se bhi kar lega kya. Ladki hona na disaster hai.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Samaaj hai beta, aisa hee hai. Nahi, hum nahi maante hain par ab rehna toh issi mein hai. Kya karein (shows her cigarette again) hmmm? Bitti looks at the cigarette a tad longer.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Aapke liye hai?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Haan. Bitti asks dad for matchbox and he searches in his pocket but couldn’t find it. She looks at him with a touch of smile. Wide angle. Back shot of both of them smoking on the terrace.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. COURTYARD —- DAY 22 Another boy has come to see Bitti with his family.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Jaao beta tum log akele mein baat waat kar lo. Bitti and boy get up and leave. Mother turns to boy’s family and speaks proudly.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bijli vibhaav ke shikayat department mein kaam karti hai Bitti. Din ki sau shikaayatein aati hain par aaj tak Bitti ki ek bhi shikayat nahi aayi. Family looks impressed.  23 15.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Balushahi leejiye na. Chhed waali balushahi poore Bareilly mein sirf Mishara ji banaate hain. Father smiles politely.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BITTI’S ROOM - DAY 23 Bitti is sitting with the boy by the verandah.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Party warty mein kabhi kabhaar ho jaati hai but waise I don’t drink. Bitti nods understandingly and gives him a fake smile.

dialogues.speaker: BOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ek cheez bas mujhe aapse poochhni thi.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Poochhiye

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Are you a... aap virgin hai kya? Bitti stares at him

dialogues.speaker: BOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Virgin... hain kya?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Aap hain?

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Uss se kya fark padta hai? Aap hain ki nahi uss se fark padta hai. Bitti thinks for a moment as she stares the boy.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Nahi hain. Ab?  24 25 26 16. The boy is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C/u of Bitti’s mother is putting the namkeen back from plates into the jars. Father picking the mithai from plate putting into the box.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Ittne ladke dekh gaye, kisi ko pasand nahi aa rahi. Kuch toh khaami hogi usme. Hum samjhaayein toh bidak jaati hai aur aapko samjhaana aata hee nahi.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Toh ka karein?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Ka karein??? Sab aaphee ka kiya dhara hai. Harkatein sab laundon wali hain. Iss se achcha tha ki launda hee paida ho jaata. Mother picks a mithai from the box to eat. As father walk out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitti sees her father walking out. She is sitting quietly on the cot outside the kitchen listening to her parents arguing. She has tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother and father are sleeping. Bitti comes on door with a bag and looks at them sleeping. She takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitti is standing on the road asking an auto to stop. Auto doesn’t stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitti is pillion riding on a scooter, sitting with both legs on one side. Wide shot of the bike going into oblivion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C/u of Bitti asking the clerk sitting inside.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Ek ticket.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Kahaan ka?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Kahin ka bhi.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Hain??? Cut to c/u of Bitti as she takes the ticket.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Haan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide shot of Bitti is sitting on a bench. Cut to c/u of Bitti looking up at someone. Cut to Hawaldaar standing in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: HAWALDAR
dialogues.text: Akele ja rahi hain?  31 18.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Haan.

dialogues.speaker: HAWALDAR
dialogues.text: Kahaan?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Sasural. Hawaladar looks at her carefully.

dialogues.speaker: HAWALDAR
dialogues.text: Sindoor aur mangalsootra kahaan hai?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Christian hain. Hawaldar gives her a blank look.

dialogues.speaker: HAWALDAR
dialogues.text: Happy journey. Wide shot of He walking away. As she sits along on the bench

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Amritsar se chal kar Jaynagar ki or jaane waali Shaheed express apne nirdharit samay se do ghante ki deri se chal rahi hai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: c/u of her making a disgusted face turning as she spots a book stall nearby. She gets up leaving her bag, comes back to pick her bag and walks towards the stall.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Yaatriyon ko hone waali asuvidha ke liye hame khed hai. Bitti reaches the stall. Cut to Munna, a young man around 25 years old, is sleeping behind the counter with his mouth open. Cut to Bitti checks a few novels and picks up one.  19.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Bhaiyya. Munna continues to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: O bhaiyya. Munna continues to sleep. Bitti throws the book at him. Munna wakes up in a jiffy, looks at Bitti and adjust his hair.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Haan ji boliye.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Woh kitaab kitne ki hai?

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Kaunsi?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Jiss se aap jaage. Munna looks at the book lying on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Ye... (picks it up) dedh sau.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Koi aur nahi hai sasti wali? Munna picks up a novel and puts it in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Ye le leejiye, assi ki hai, saath mein de denge. Bitti picks up the book and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Bareilly ki barfi?

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Chaliye pachaas de deejiye. Bitti is looking at the book.  32 33 34 35 20.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Chaalees se kam nahi ho paayega, sorry. Bitti is about to keep the book down. C/u of munna giving the book.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Achcha tees hain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitti is reading the book sitting by the window in general compartment. Music takes over as she reads the book. Her eyes go wide as she turns the pages. She turns another page in a hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Train crosses in full speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitti closes the book and looks stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Train comes to halt at a station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitti looks out. There is another train going in the opposite direction. She calls out to the guy at the opposite window.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Ye Bareilly rukti hai?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Haan.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. IN BETWEEN TRAINS —- CONTINUOUS 37 Bitti gets down from her train and hops on to the other.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BITTI’S ROOM —- EARLY MORNING 38 Bitti’s mother, looking horrified, is reading a letter.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Hum ja rahe hain ma. Tumhare aur papa ki sukh shanti ke liye ye hee achcha hai. Jo tumne blouse mein hajaar ka note phasa ke rakha tha woh sath liye ja rahe hain. Mother gently touches her blouse and continues to read.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Usko aur humko dhoondhne ki koshish mat karna. Tumhaari museebat... (turns and screams) Bitttttiiiiii. And she stops abruptly. Bitti is standing at the door with bags Mother gets emotional. She hugs Bitti.  39 22.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kahaan ja rahi thi karamjali?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Ghar chhod ke.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Toh gayi kyon nahi?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Tumhaari khushi dekhi nahi jaati na humse, issi liye. Both look at each other with tears in their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mein sone ja rahi hu

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Pura din soti rehti hai Father enters the frame from behind.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Arre bhai bharat milaap ho gaya ho toh chai pila do.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. RAMA’S BOUTIQUE - DAY 39 Aunty with the magazine is sitting with Rama and telling her to design a dress similar to that picture Rama is cutting a magazine design of a dress.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Pagla gayi ho ka? Ghar chhod ke ja rahi thi. Bitti placing the book on her magazine.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Arre pagla toh tu jaayegi. Ye dekh. Rama picks the book.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Bareilly ki barfi?  23. Bitti sits on the table.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Padh padh padh. Rama starts reading the book.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Poora nahi, jitta mark kiya hain utta padh.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: (reading) Bareily mein rehti hai, break dance karti hai, chhup chhup ke cigarette peeti hai, baat baat pe sau ki shart lagaati hai. Rama looks amazed.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ye toh tu hai.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Haina?... Bareily ki barfi... Bitti. Aisi aisi baatein likhi hain jo sirf tujhe aur mujhe pata hain. Rama is speechless as she flips pages.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hamare jaisi sirf hum hee nahi. Aur... koi toh hai, jisse lagta hai main jaisi bhi hoon achchi hoon aur usse pasand hoon.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Is barfi ka maalpua hai kaun? Rama looks at the book.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Isne likhi hai? Pritam Vidrohi? Jaanti hai isko?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Tch. Bitti shakes her head in a no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide shot of a bike coming towards camera. When the bike comes closer it’s Chirag riding on his bike, wearing latest goggles.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Ab aapko lag raha hoga ki ye Pritam Vidrohi hain. Hain na? Nahi hain. Ye hain apne ghar ke eklaute Chirag... Chirag Dubey.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. PRINTING PRESS
dialogues.text: Chirag parks the bike and climbs the steps acknowledging people.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Inke pitaji ka sapna tha ki ye doctor ya engineer bann ke note chhaapein. Chhaapte ye ab bhi hain...

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. PRINTING PRESS
dialogues.text: Chirag enters the press and looks at the shop. He places a titled wedding card straight on the rack on the front.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Lekin pamphlet, visiting card, shaadi ke card ityadi... apne pitaji ki printing press mein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag is looking at some papers getting printed. As he passed he stops near the DTP operator.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: (bending and looking at him) Rajesh wets Priti nahi naalayak, Rajesh Weds Priti.  44 45 46 25. C/u of him looking at the DTP guy, removing the T and typing a ‘d’ on keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Din bhar kaam karte hain.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CHIRAG’S ROOM - NIGHT 44 Chirag is pouring a drink.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Aur raat mein jaam bharte hain, Babli ke sath. Aa ba... Babli dikh nahi rahi? Chirag takes out a snap from his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ai... ye aa gayi. C/u of Chirag is looking at the snap as he drinks and tears start rolling.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kehte hain wagt har zakhm bhar deta hai. Inka abhi bhi hara hai. Paanch saal pehle Babli inke purse mein nahi inke paas mein thi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag and babli on a bike with a kite flying tied to the bike. EXT. MARKET ROAD — EVENING 46 Chirag and babli eating pani puri. Chirag putting one in her mouth as she gobbles one more.  47 48 49 50 51 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag and Babli at his home blowing a heart candle and smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babli slowly closes her house door as chirag says bye with coy. C/u of Door shutting.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Babli ke bina inka time pass nahi hota tha. Par Babli ke liye ye sirf timepass the.

dialogues.speaker: SOUND CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. MARRIAGE HALL —- NIGHT 49 C/u of Chirag standing behind the pandal, crying louder seeing Babli crying while leaving her folks after getting married.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Babli ki vidaai mein Babli se zyada ye roye the.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO PRESENT
dialogues.text: INT. CHIRAG’S ROOM - NIGHT 50 Chirag is drinking, looking at Babli’s snap.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Us din se inki zindagi mein koi aayi hee nahi...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CHIRAG’S HOUSE - MORNING 51 Chirag’s mother is showing him the snaps of girls. Chirag shakes his head in a no, keeping the photo straight.  27.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: ++. kyonki inko aur koi bhaayi hee nahi. Mother puts another snap in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Rajni?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Na khud peeti hai, na peene degi. Mother makes a face.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Bindiya?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Bas dikhti shareef hai.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Kusum?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Bina make up ke dikhe toh asli shakal maaloom pade. Mom is exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Jaise tu bada heera hai. Chirag gets irritated and walks out taking the stairs down.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Aaj bhi har ladki mein Babli ko dhoondh rahe hain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag is riding on his bike.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Bitti ki tarah Chirag ka bhi Pritam Vidrohi ke saath ek ajeeb sa connection hai.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: 53 54 28. INT. CHIRAG’S ROOM - NIGHT 53 Chirag is writing something, wearing the same sherwani he had worn in Babli’s wedding.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Jis raat Babli apne ghar se aur inki zindagi se vida hui thi ussi raat inhone apni prem kahaani ko amar banaane ki bheeshma pratigya le lee thi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: c/u of machine is making some noise Wide shot of chirag and Munna standing against the machine. Cut to Munna reading the manuscript. Chirag is watching him in eager.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Aur inki kitaab ka first draft padha inke langotiya yaar Munna ne, jinse aap thodi der pehle book stall pe mil chuke hain. Cut to Munna asking in wonder.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Toone likhi hai?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: (emotionally) Aansuon ne likhi hai.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Photo khinchwa lo lalla, kitaab pe daalni padti hai. Chirag shakes his head in a no.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Par Chirag babu thehre sachche aashiq.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag is staring at the game on TV while Munna is playing game of hitting As the man on the game is hit, Munna rejoice and looks at Chirag, but it does not distract Chirag, he is still thinking. C/u of chirag looking at Munna and smiling (he has got a idea)

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Apni photo ke sath chhapte toh Babli badnaam ho jaati. Munna ki photo ke saath chhapte toh kitaab badnaam ho jaati. Ab bas ek maatra bharose ka muhbola dost bacha tha.

dialogues.speaker: ENDING TO
dialogues.text: EXT. TEA STALL —- EARLY EVENING 56 Pritam Vidrohi, a soft spoken and meek looking guy, is narrating his poem to friends. Chirag and Munna are also sitting there.

dialogues.speaker: PRITAM
dialogues.text: Preet ki reet mein aiso uljho, khol sako na koi, preet ki reet mein bas uljhan hai, kahat Pritam Vidrohi. Friends applaud. One of the guys raises his hand and Pritam gets scared and takes a defensive pose. Friend smiles and pats on Pritam’s back and Pritam looks relieved. Chirag and Munna exchange a smile. C/u of chirag having that mission accomplished look.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. PRITAM’S ROOM - NIGHT 57 Pritam is shaking his head in a scared no. Chirag and Munna are sitting in front of him.  30. c/u of Manuscript is lying nearby.

dialogues.speaker: PRITAM
dialogues.text: Par likhi toh aapne hai na Chirag Bhaiya.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Haan toh?

dialogues.speaker: PRITAM
dialogues.text: Toh mere naam se kaise chhap sakti hai?

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Kyon nahi chhap sakti be?

dialogues.speaker: PRITAM
dialogues.text: (scared) Nahi... chhap sakti hai par chhapni nahi chahiye. Galat hoga.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Galat toh ye hoga ki hum jabardasti chhap dein aur tum kuch ukhaad bhi na paao. Pritam gulps down his saliva.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dekho Vidrohi, dost ho isliye permission maang rahe hain. Pritam just looks at him. Chirag goes closer to him.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ek baat aur lalla. Thukraaye hue aashiq ki haay mat lo. Jindagi bhar laundiya ko taras jaaoge. Pritam helplessly looks at Chirag and then looks at Munna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag and Munna are standing next to a photographer.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: (sternly) Smile.  31. Pritam Vidrohi smiles forcefully and frame freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pages are getting published. Chirag and Munna are supervising.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Iske baad chupke se chhapi gayi thi... Chirag picks up the printed cover and smiles emotionally.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Bareilly ki Barfi. C/u of The back cover shows the snap of Pritam Vidrohi.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO DREAM
dialogues.text: 60 EXT. PRITAM’S COLONY LANE —- NIGHT 60 Quick cuts for various NGO women protesting outside his place. His mother is screaming in silence with tears (like three idiots mother)

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Uske baad Pritam Vidrohi ke saath woh hua jo kisi ne sapne mein bhi nahi socha tha...

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO
dialogues.text: 61 INT. PRITAM’S ROOM - NIGHT 61 Pritam wakes up sweating touching his face as if he is actually slapped.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: ...Sivaay Pritam Vidrohi ke.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 62 63 64 65 66 32. INT.PRITAM HOUSE —- NIGHT 62 Pritam taking his mom photograph from the rack along with him crying and packs his bag. (in and out transtition)

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. PRITAM’S HOUSE LANE - NIGHT 63 Wide shot Pritam walking on the road, which turns into walking fast, looking back if someone noticed him.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. RAILWAY PLATFORM —- NIGHT 64 Pritam is boarding a train still in tears.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Ussi raat badnami ke darr se Pritam Vidrohi shahar se palaayan kar gaye the.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BOOK SHOP —- DAY 65 Chirag is keeping an eye on people buying books. One girl picks up Bareily ki Barfi, looks at it, giggles with her friend and keeps it back. Chirag is disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Khaamkhaan palaayan kar gaye. Ek copy tak nahi biki Bareilly ki Barfi ki.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. CHIRAG’S HOUSE - DAY 66 Mother is selling the book to the raddi wala.  67 68 69 33.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Biki toh sirf raddi mein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People eating samosa, kachori etc on a paper.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Aur dikhi toh sirf samosa, kachori, poha, jalebi ke neeche. A paper is thrown in bin. Title on top reads Bareily ki Barfi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Munna is dusting the books in his stall.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Apne jigri ka dil rakhne ke liye Munna ne dus copies apne stall pe saja ke rakhi... with due prominence.

dialogues.speaker: PRESENT
dialogues.text: INT. RAMA’S BOUTIQUE- EARLY EVENING 69 Rama who is stitching something on the machine. The book is kept next to the machine where bitti is sitting and checking something on her mobile.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Paanch saal mein pehli copy biki jo thode din pehle Bitti ne khareedi. C/u of google. It shows no match found for pritam vidhrohi. but some photos of pritam the music director. Cut to Bitti looking a little impatient.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Hai kaun ye Pritam Vidrohi? Google bhi isse nahi dhoondh pa raha hai.  34. Cut to Rama stopping the machine and looking at the phone.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: yeh Pritam toh Music director hai. (stops) Tum kaahe iske peechche itna pagla rahi ho?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Kaahe na ho? Jindagi badal dee hai inhone hamaari. Bitti picks up the book and looks at the back side. Pritam Vidrohi’s snap is looking at her with a nervous smile.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Isme bhi bas itna hee likha hai ki Bareilly ke hain. Rama starts stitching again.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: (talking loudly) Hamne toh kabhi nahi suna naam. Aur shakal toh dekho, aisa lag raha hai jaise jabardasti has rahe ho. Bitti walking away with the book. Rama looks at her walking aways. Stops the machine and walks behind her in a hurry. When a aunty carrying sabji to enter the side house crosses her.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTY
dialogues.text: Rama, woh meri (a movie name) dress ho gayi? Walking towards the bike, which Bitti is already ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: (not looking at aunty) Ho gayi aunty. Sitting on the kinetic type bike as the bike zooms  70 35.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (looking behind) same to same. kal le leeiye. Aunty smiles nodding to see them zooming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitti walks to the stall with Rama. Munna recognizes her. Bitti shows her the book.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Ye kitaab hamne yahaan se khareedi thi. Munna slyly shows her the board outside.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Ek baar bechi hui kitaab waapas nahi lee jaayegi. No, not, never.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Abbe laakh rupai do toh bhi na lautaayein.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Hain!!! Itni pasand aa gayi? Bitti shows her the book.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Pritam Vidrohi ji kahaan milenge?

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Kyon?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Aapse matlab.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Matlab?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Matlab ye ki jitna poochcha jaaye utna bataao. Munna keeps a straight face and looks at her.  71

dialogues.speaker: BITTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kahaan milenge? (shows book) Isme likha hai Bareliy ke hee rehne waale hain.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Raha karte the. Aajkal kahaan hain kisi ko nahi pata. Bitti looks disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Oh. She turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Aur pata chal gaya toh? Bitti turns back.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Toh pata likh lo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Munna is sitting and talking to Chirag who looks surprised.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Hain?

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Haan... Aur pooch rahi thi ki writer kaun hai.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Achcha.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Paanch saal ho gaye bhaiya vanvaas ke, ab prayaas karne ka samay hai.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Arre chhod yaar.  72

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Hum mein koi itna interest leta toh hum toh katai na chhodte.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Pata hai.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Pata haiii (takes out the address)... de ke gayi hai. Chirag is even more surprised.

dialogues.speaker: DAY 72
dialogues.text: Wide shot of early morning bareilly city

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transition shot from man with hath gadi to chirag and munna on bike. Munna is blabbering as Chirag rides.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Tumhara kaam hai bhaiya, tum hi jao. Hum kyun jaayein? Hamaare jaane ka sawaal hi paida nahi hota. Phir toh hum jaane se rahe.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT/EXT. BITTI’S HOUSE - DAY 73 Bitti’s father opens the door. Munna gives him a wide smile, holding a register and a pen. Chirag is watching them from a distance.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Jan Gan-na ke liye aaye hain.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: (straight face) Gin lo.  74 38.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Ghar mein kaun kaun hai?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Dekh lo. Father walks in. INT. BITTI’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 74 Munna follows him in the house, opens his register and sits on the cot. He sees mother busy doing something nearby.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Aap do, aur bachhe?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Ek ladki hai.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Bas ek hi ladki hai?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Ek hi kaafi hai.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Shaadi ho gayi?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Ho hi nahi rahi.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: (curiously) Kyun? There is an awkward silence for a couple of seconds. MUNNA (CONT’D (CONT'D) Kyu nahi hogi, bilkul hogi... aur jab bhi ho... toh card hamaare bhaiya ke yahan se hi chapwaiyega... chauk pe dukaan hai... Good Luck Printing Press. Bitti looks down from the terrace and recognizes Munna. Munna looks at her and smiles.  75 76 39.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kitaabein bhi chhapte hain... Bareilly ki Barfi bhi toh wahin chhapi thi. Bitti’s Father gives him a weird look. Bitti smiles to herself. Mother comes with some refreshment in a tray.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Aur bhaiya, shaadi waadi ho gayi.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Haan Aunty ho gayi. As Munna reaches for the refreshment with a smile, mother pulls it back.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Theek hai bhaiya, jao. Munna’s smile disappears.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. TEA STALL — DAY 75 Munna and Chirag are sipping tea.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Bhaiya kanni humne baandh di, Maanjha humne soot diya... chhudaiyya bhi de aaye hain. Ab patang aapke haath mein hai... uda sako toh uda lena. Aur zara sambhal ke udana... paagalon ka parivaar hai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close up of computer screen, a wedding card layout reads ‘Manju Beds Raja’. Chirag is looking at the layout. He hits the DTP operator on the back of his head.  40.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Abe Beds nahi Weds. Itne joote padenge ki.. Bitti is at the entrance of printing press and looking up at the board. He looks up and sees salwar kameez. Bitti walking in, wearing a red

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ponnd Laal ho jaayegi. He walks up to Bitti.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (broken English) Welcome to good luck printing press. It is the favorite for.. - Wedding cards, Birthday Cards, Visiting cards, chautha and teraviin.. cards. Bitti shows him the book.

dialogues.speaker: BIT
dialogues.text: And books a

dialogues.speaker: LSO.
dialogues.text: Chirag is a little scandalized looking at the book.

dialogues.speaker: CH
dialogues.text: Ye kahan mi

dialogues.speaker: BIT
dialogues.text: Ye kahan mil Bitti turns the book

dialogues.speaker: RAG
dialogues.text: Li?

dialogues.speaker: ITI
dialogues.text: enge? and points at the snap of Pritam Vidrohi. Chirag realizes that she is the one.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Ye... kahan milenge... aapne aane mein 5 saal der kar di.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Kya... ye nahi rahe? Chirag clarifies.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Iss sheher mein nahi rahe.  41.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Oh. Phone number, email id, address... kuch bhi chalega.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Kuch bhi nahi milega.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Kyu?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Hamaari company ki privacy policy hai. Fans ka bada problem hai, koi chhat se kood jata hai, koi nas kaat leta hai... ek toh kachhua chhap kha ke marr gayi. Ye log toh nikal lete hain... phas jaate hain hamaare jaise shareef log. Waise kaam kya tha?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Kuch personal tha. Chalo koi nahi, thank you. As Bitti turns to go, Chirag is thinking.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Suniye. Bitti turns back.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Because... aapka kaam itna important hai... main try kar sakta hun... agar aap mujhe bata dein ki itna kya personal hai? Cut to workers curiously staring as the printing is on.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Yahaan? Bitti gives a silent look. Chirag looks around and understands her dilemma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag is sitting motionless, with his mouth open, holding an ice-cream stick, not even blinking. Bitti is sitting right opposite him.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Aapki kulfi poori pighal gayi. Chirag looks down with his mouth open and sees the melted ice-cream on the plate.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Haan... haan... Chirag looks back at Bitti.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Matlab aap ye keh rahi hain... ki aap ‘Bareilly ki barfi’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hain?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Haan.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Lekin aisa kaise ho sakta hai?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Wahi to main jaanna chahti hun.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Aapko... break dance... aata hai?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Haan. Chirag then gestures smoking with the ice-cream stick.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Haan cigarette bhi peeti hun.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: English picture?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Dekhti hun.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Samajh mein aati hai?  79 78 43. Bitti gives him a dirty look.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dekhti hain to aati hee hogi... heh heh.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Tabhi toh main Vidrohi Ji se milna chahti hun... wo mujhe itni achhi tarah se kaise jaante hain?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Mujhe kya pata?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Haan, aapko kaise pata hoga?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Haan... wahi toh... (thinks) dekhiye phone number aur address toh main aapko doonga nahi, facebook aur email pe woh hain nahin... ek kaam kijiye aap letter likh deejiye... main un tak pahuncha doonga.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Aur unka jawaab aaya toh?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Toh aap tak pahuncha doonga. Bitti smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. BITTI’S HOUSE - NIGHT 79 Wide shot of the whole building. All lights closed except one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide shot of Munna and Chirag are sitting and eating chole pattice, chatting at the book stall. C/u of Munna eating.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Bitti... Bareilly ki barfi hai?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Aisa woh bol rahi hai.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Par Bareilly ki barfi toh Babli bhabhi thi na?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Wah oopar waale... ek aam mein do guthli. Ek bitti ek Babli. Usey pata hai toone likhi hai?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Tch.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Batayega usko?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Pehle ye toh pata lage ki wo sach bol rahi hai ki phek rahi hai.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Sach nikla toh?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: (smiles hopefully) Toh prayaas karenge.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Aur jhoot nikla toh?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Toh vanvaas toh chal hee raha hai. Chirag continues to eat. Wide shot of the whole building. All lights closed except one room.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 80 81 45. INT. BITTI’S ROOM - NIGHT 80 Bitti is going through an album along with Rama as she is busy eating something.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Bataao, facebook pe hota toh DP dekh leti.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Ye wali daal doon?

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Tch. Bitti flips the page. Rama looks at the snap.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ye wali daal de.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Tch. Isme thodi healthy lag rahi hoon.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Sirf letter bhej na, photo kyon bhej rahi hai.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: (smiling) Arre Raj ko bhi toh pata chale uski Simran dikhti kaisi hai. Bitti flips another page and looks at another page.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ye daal doo? Isme thoda pait bhi dikh raha hai. Bitti keeps the letter inside the bijli vibhag envelope and folds it. C/u of photograph being closed by the letter.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CHIRAG’S ROOM —- EVENING 81 Chirag sees the bijli vibhag envelope and is confused C/u of photograph being held by hand.  82 46. Camera pans to see Munna is looking at the snap while Chirag is reading the letter.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Bhaiya isme toh pait bhi dikh raha hai. Babli bhabhi jaisi advance hain ye toh. Chirag snatches the snap from Munna’s hands.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Likha kya hai? Chirag, looking a bit emotional, reads out the letter to Munna.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Sabko hum mein sirf aib hee nazar aate hain. Aapko unhi aibon mein khoobiyaan dikhi... jaankar achcha laga. Laga koi toh hai jo hame samajhta hai. Kabhi Bareily aana hua toh ghar zaroor aaiyega. Hamari dukaan ki barfi bhi kam meethi nahi hai. Aapki Babli, Bitti. Munna looks at Chirag.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Bhaiya ye toh senti ho gayi... (looks carefully at Chirag) Bhaiya aap bhi senti ho gaye? Chirag is looking into the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. CHIRAG’S ROOM - NIGHT 82 C/u of Chirag’s hands writing a letter. Bitti’s snap is kept on the table, next to drinks’ glass. Wide of him writing in his room.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 83 84 47. INT. CHIRAG’S HOUSE - MORNING 83 Chirag is getting up from the breakfast table to rush out. Mother speaks from the small square hole on the wall from the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Kahaan ja raha hai?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Baahar. Chirag rushes out. Cut to Mother screaming from the hole.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Besan le aana, ek paav... boondi banaani hai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag is riding on his bike. Munna, eating jalebi at a shop, spots him.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: O Chirag bhaiya! Chirag stops on hearing his name, turns his bike and comes near Munna. Munna orders the shop guy.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ai Tillu, poha jalebi de bhiya ko.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Nahi yaar main jaldi mein hoon.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Aap aur jaldi mein? Kahaan?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Jawab dene.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Kal sawaal aaya aur aaj jawaab dene jaa rahe ho? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Arre itta fast toh Bareliy ka internet bhi nahi chalta. Do char din ruk ke dena warna pakde jaaoge, bataaye de rahe hain. Chirag is thinking.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Achcha. Ai Tillu de na poha jalebi.

dialogues.speaker: TILLU, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: abbahi haal la re, Bhaiya

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. PRINTING PRESS —- DAY 85 There is Ram baarat celebration outside printing press. Bitti on bike stops outside the press.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. PRINTING PRESS
dialogues.text: C/u of Chirag opening his mouth concentrating, putting the wedding cards in order, in a line. Bitti stops outside the shop, sitting behind a bike.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Aaya kya?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: (looking through the glass wall.) Aayega. She leaves on the Bike. Chirag watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitti is doing a break dance copying someone on Youtube.  87 88 89 90 49. Rama who has been working on a jean pulls it up and through the hole made on the jean is asking.

dialogues.speaker: RAMA
dialogues.text: Aaya kya? Looking at the dance video trying to keep up to the steps

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Aayega.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag is riding his bike, dressed nicely. EXT. BITTI’S HOUSE LANE — MORNING 88 He reaches Bitti’s lane, parks his bike and rings her house door bell.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BITTI’S HOUSE —- MORNING 89 Bitti’s father is making mithaai boxes of the open cardboard gets up to open the door.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. BITTI’S HOUSE LANE — MORNING 90 OTS Bitti’s father opens the door and sees Chirag.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Namaste uncle. Cut to father looking with no expression.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Namaste. Kaise aana hua?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Uncle mera press hai.  50.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Mubarak ho. Meri mithai ki dukaan hai. Waise ek shirt press karne ka kitna lete ho? Chirag gestures with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Nahi uncle, printing press hai... printing. C/u of father looking at his actions.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Arre beta toh hum kya karein? Bitti comes from behind.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Arre papa ye Chirag ji hain, Good Luck Printing press waale. Aaiye aaiye. Chirag steps in along with them. Father is ahead. Chirag senses an opportunity and hands over the letter to Bitti. Father asks Bitti.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Toh ghar kyon aa gaye?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Arre apni dukaan ke pachaas saal poore hone waale hain na...

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Haan haan... toh?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Arre golden jubilee pamphlet chhapwa denge toh prachaar hoga na. Chirag smiles at Bitti’s reply.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Paanch sau mein hajaar chhaap denge uncle. Black and white ke rate pe golden ink mein. No extra charge.  51. Mother steps in and looks at Chirag.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Aur beta shaadi ho gayi?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: (blushing) Jee nahi aunty.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: (beaming) Sharbat piyoge?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Nahi aunty.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Arre aise thodi na jaane denge. She walks back.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Tumhaari na hamaari, chaar sau mein baarah sau chhaap do. Kab tak de doge? Chirag looks at Bitti.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Aap apna mobile number de deejiye, kaam ho jaayega toh whatsup kar denge. Father yells out for his wife.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Arre Susheela hamaare mobile ka number kya hai? Mother walks in with sharbat.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Tumhaara phone hai, tum jaano.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Arre hum khud ko thodi na phone karte hain.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Aap mera number le leejiye.  91 92

dialogues.speaker: 92A
dialogues.text: 93 94 95 52. Chirag smiles as he takes sharbat from mother who is all smiles too with father going back to his folding of boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag is riding on his bike, wide grin on his face. INT. BITTI’S HOUSE - DAY 92 Bitti in office clothes.runs towards the terrace, throws her bag and looks at the letter in her hand. EXT. TERRACE — EVENING 92A Bitti is reading the letter, sitting against the parapet. some boys are flying kite on the terrace. INT.PRINTING PRESS —- DAY 93 Chirag is looking at Bitti’s facebook profile. He smiles at her various snaps. He then sends her a friendship request.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitti is writing a letter. She sees the request on her phone. She continues to write the letter. Complaint phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT.PRINTING PRESS —- EVENING 95 Bitti has come over to Chirag’s shop. She quietly gives Chirag the letter and leaves. Chirag keeps staring at her as she leaves with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag is reading the letter on the terrace with a smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT.PRINTING PRESS —- DAY 97 Chirag hitting the DTP operator on his head in his shop. And then corrects “Golden Jalebi” to “Golden Jubilee”. oNT,._LIBRARY —DAY 98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitti is checking some books in the library shelf, She _removes—_one book fromthe shelf and from opposite

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Side—Chiraglooks_at_her_

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag on the bike with the pamplets on the bonnet in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitti’s father looking at the pamphlets. c/u of chirag holding a half empty orange rasna. His lips are slightly orange, he is looking tensed when father smiles and looks pleased he also smiles. Mother brings in another glass of sharbat for Chirag.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ELECTRICITY OFFICE —- EARLY EVENING 100 Chirag is waiting on a bike for Bitti at the entrance. Bitti comes with the others when she sees her. Bitti laughs to sit on her bike. They both drive together one after the other.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SOME NICE PLACE
dialogues.text: Chirag and Bitti sitting. Chirag gives her the letter with a big happy grin on his face. Bitti grabs to read it. Chirag is watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitti inside the rajjai, looks at FB and accepts request with a smile. Phone light goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag talking on phone engrossed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitti talking on phone engrossed. Her landline line rings and she picks keeping that phone in the other ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag laughs hearing what she says on phone, fully almost in love with her. as he looks at a printed paper and bangs his head on the machine, since its a mistake but still smiles hearing on phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag and Bitti are walking when they see bhaarat going and every body dancing. She joins them doing a break dance number. Asks Chirag, who refuses and just stares at her in awe. Bitti dancing in slow motion.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 107 108 109 55. INT. RAMA’S BOUTIQUE - LATE EVENING 107 Chirag giving Bitti a pen drive. Bitti puts the pen drive in the laptop. Chirag happy. All three of them are watching a movie, while chirag stares with a wide smile at Bitti explaining everything.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. RAMA’S BOUTIQUE - LATE EVENING 108 Both of them are standing next to the house. Bitti takes a puff with full leisure, gives the rest to chirag and waves her mouth to remove the duaa and says a bye.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NON VEG PLACE
dialogues.text: Bitti eating non veg with Chirag in khaaoo gali. Rama is watching the two of them and smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitti and Chirag watching something incredible (like kadaklaxmi or a headstand). Bitti says, “Ye toh main bhi kar sakti hoon.” Chirag looks at her in disbelief. Bitti says, “Lagi sau sau ki”. Next moment she is doing it. Cut to Chirag giving her 100 bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitti is starting the bike, chirag is sitting behind when a rangbaaz kind of guy walks past gives her a flying kiss. Bitti is so pissed that she runs behind him. Rangbaaz also runs in fear. Chirag also runs behind her. Finally to get her back. Chirag is panting. Bitti is still angry.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 112 113 114 56. INT. CHIRAG’S PRINTING PRESS - DAYERIOR. 112 Chirag is packing papers in a box. Munna is helping him. Munna talking to Chirag.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Matlab Bitti poori poori Babli bhabhi hai?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: 95 percent. Munna looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whispers) Peeth pe til waali baat abhi tak confirm nahi hui hai. Munna laughs sheepishly that he knows the secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a banner put outside the office. ‘vidyut vibhaag Annual day’. Bitti earing a sari comes out with a trophy and sweet box. Chirag smiles looking at her in a sari. Bitti sits on her bike to start. Chirag sits behind to notice the mole on bitti’s neck back.His eyes go wide in amazement, as bitti turns to give him the sweetbox, and cup. He gives her a wide smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man carrying kite maanja passes Bitti riding the bike, chirag sitting behind like a papluu with the trophy and sweet box. long Kite maanja being preparedd in the b/g. INT. CHIRAG ROOM —- NIGHT 115 Chirag takes out Babli’s snap from his wallet and puts Bitti’s snap inside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag and Bitti are drinking and chatting.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Tum mujhe achche lagte ho Chirag.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Aisa kya kar diya maine? Chirag shrugs his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Yaar mera paala hamesha akdoo aur rangbaaz type ke hee ladko se pada hai. Khud ko pata nahi kya samajhte hain aur saamnewaale ko kuch bhi nahi. Chirag smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Aur main?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Tum bade Libra type ke ho, tula rashi.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Tumhe kaise pata?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Arre tula waale na balance bana ke rakhte hain. Papa bhi hain, mere aur mummy ke beech mein balance bana ke rakhte hain. Chirag nods. Bitti realizes something suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Matlab tumhaara budday aane waala hai.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Bas 23 minute mein jaane waala hai.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI, (SURPRISED)
dialogues.text: Aaj tumhara Birthday hai?  58.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Toh?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Toh kya? Utho... aur chalo.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Kahan?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Arre chalo na batati hun. Bitti hurries him on the bike and they leave.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. SWEET SHOP
dialogues.text: They reach Bitti’s father’s sweet shop. Chirag reads the sign board in Hindi which reads Lovla Sweets.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Lovla Sweets? Bitti corrects him by shaking her head in a no.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Lovely Sweets. Pichchli baarish mein ee ki maatra gir gayi thi. Chirag then looks at the lock on the shutter.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Chabi hai?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Arre ye papa choron ko ullu banaane ke liye lagaate hain. Bitti just gives a jerk to the lock and it opens. Chirag is surprised. Bitti is busy lifting the shutter.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Arre pagal ho kya?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Haan. (Matter of fact) Chirag looks around and then helps Bitti with the shutter. They get inside.  59. Bitti takes out barfi from the display unit and feeds it to Chirag.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Happy Birthday Chirag babu.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Thank you (Blushes)

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Kaisi hai?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: (Playfully) Pheeki hai. Bitti then kisses Chirag on his cheek. Chirag is ecstatic. Bitti blushes too.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Ab? Chirag smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. BITTI’S COURTYARD - NIGHT 118 Father opens the door. Bitti walks in, looking happy. He sees her go inside, sniffs and realizes that she was drinking. He looks up towards the sky and raises both his hands as if telling God “Yahi kasar reh gayi thi”. Then he peeps outside and sees Chirag going away on his bike. He thinks for a moment and then closes the door. INT. FATHER’S BEDROOM - NIGHT 119 Mother is sleeping. Father is talking to himself.  60.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Ladka waise theek thaak hee hai, dikhta bhi achcha hee hai, massa wassa bhi nahi hai chehre pe, khair woh toh ghode ke baal se chaar din mein kat jaata hai, ab press hai toh kama bhi theek thaak hee leta hoga, bike toh hai hee, aur bataao, kal ko kahin press band ho gayi toh apni mithai ki dukaan toh hai hee, kuch kare na kare makhkhi toh udaa hee lega.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag is sitting with Bitti. Bitti is reading a letter. She finishes reading it and looks thoughtful.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Mujhe pata hai Vidrohi ji kya likhte honge.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Achcha. Toh bataao James Bond.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Yahi ki badi pyaari baatein karti ho, handwriting bahut achchi hai aur jab tumhara letter kholta hoon na toh tumhaari khushboo aati hai bheeni bheeni. Saying this Chirag closes his eyes as if he can smell Bitti’s fragrance.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Woh poore mohalle ko aati hai. Ye bata main kya likhti hoon.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Tum toh mari jaa rahi ho milne ke liye. Bitti’s head goes down.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kya hua?  61.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Yaar teen baar main letter mein likh chuki hoon ki Vidrohi ji, mujhe aapse milna hai, mujhe aapse milna hai, haar baar tarka dete hain.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Ho sakta hai usse tumse nahi milna ho.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Toh phir main letter likhna band kar deti hoon.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: (quickly) Nahi, ho sakta hai milna ho. Mujhe kya pata.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Haan toh main bhi bas ek baar milna chahti hoon. Jo mujhe itne achche tarah se jaanta hai uss se ek baar milna toh banta hai. Aur unse bas tu hee milwa sakta hai. Chirag is just looking at her.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Milwaayega na?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Woh tumhe pasand nahi aaya toh?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Nahi aaya toh nahi aaya.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Aur aa gaya toh?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Toh hamaare saath saath mummy aur papa ko bhi pasand aana padega. Aa gaya toh aay haay, nahi toh bye bye. Chirag is thinking.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Milwa na yaar. Please.  62. C/u of Bitti looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 121 INT. CHIRAG’S ROOM - NIGHT 121 Chirag is ironing his shirt. Munna is sitting nearby.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Par tu milwaayega kaise? Vidrohi ko bhaage toh paanch saal ho gaye. Kya pata jinda hai ki kharch ho gaya.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Abbe uss se kaun milwa raha hai?

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Toh?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Kitaab ka asli writer kaun hai?

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Tu.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Letters ka writer kaun hai?

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Tu.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Toh jaake milega kaun?

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Tuuuu??? Chirag lifts the shirt and looks at it with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 122 EXT. CHIRAG’S HOUSE - MORNING 122 Chirag is walking down the stairs in a hurry wearing the same shirt. Mother from the door looking down.  123 124 63.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Kahaan ja raha hai subah subah scent maar ke?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Kaam se.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: (screaming) Aavla lete aana... aur suno bade bade laana, murabba banaana hai. Chirag walks out shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag is riding his bike with a smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BITTI’S COURTYARD — CONTINUOUS 124 Chirag is about to enter when he suddenly stops at the entrance alley on hearing something. Bitti’s mother is screaming at her at the top of her voice, holding the book. Father is watching quietly.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Aisi kitaabein padh padh ke hee bigad rahi hai. Cigarette peeti hai par achchi hai, angrezi picture dekhti hai par sweet hai, yahi padh padh ke aise lachchan ho gaye tumhaari raajdulaari ke. Chirag slowly enters the house. Mother is looking at Vidrohi’s snap on the book.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ek apna Chirag hai itna sabhya aur susheel. Aur ek ye manhoos.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Manhoos mat boliye unko.  64.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Chup kar tu. Mil jaaye toh sharbat mein jahar mila ke pila denge naaspite ko. She throws the book and it hits Chirag. Mother sees him and mellows down.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aur beta, yahaan kaise?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Ji bas aise hee idhar se guzar raha tha toh...

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Haan toh aao baitho, sharbat peeke jaana.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: (scared) Nahi nahi... chalta hoon Aunty. Aap log busy lag rahe ho. Chirag quickly takes a u turn and scoots away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag is riding on his bike, looking worried.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 126 INT. CHIRAG’S ROOM - NIGHT 126 Chirag is refilling drinks. Munna is squeezing lemon over cucumber.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Ek taraf ladki hai jo lekhak pe jaan dene ko taiyaar baithi hai aur ek taraf hai uski amma, jo jaan lene ko taiyaar baithi hai.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Ab kya karoge lekhak babu?  65.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Pyaar kiya hai Munna, kurbaani toh deni padegi.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Toh ho jaao uski amma ke haathon shaheed.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Abbe jab ooparwala akal baant raha tha toh tu kya chooran chaat raha tha? Munna just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Book pe naam kiska hai?

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Pritam Vidrohi.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Photo kisi hai?

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Pritam Vidrohi.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Toh kurbani kaun dega?

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Pritam Vidrohi???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bhaiya aapke phirst love ke chakkar mein usse shahar chhodna pada, second love ke chakkar mein duniya na chhodni pad jaaye... kisi ke saath itna bura bhi nahi karna chahiye. Both look at each other for a moment quietly, Chirag nodding his head in agreement. Then suddenly he giggles.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Chhod na, karte hain... maza aayega.  127 Munna giggles too.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Par ye aajkal hai kahaan? INT. VIDROHI’S HOUSE - DAY Camera pulls back from an old framed photo of Chirag, Munna and Vidrohi. Vidrohi’s mother is brining in tea in the courtyard. Chirag and Munna are sitting on the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Aur beta, bade dino baad aana hua?

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: (fake emotions) Bas aunty puraana album dekh rahe the, Vidrohi ki photo dekhi toh aankh bhar aayi.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: (eagerly) Kahaan, hain kahaan aajkal?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Woh toh bahut bada aadmi ho gaya beta. Bahut badi company mein sales manager hai... woh bikri wikri nahi dekhte... woh karne laga hai. Chirag and Munna exchange a look. Mother takes out an ATM card from her blouse.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Je ATM deke gaya hai. Jitti marji nikaal lo. Lekin jaroorat hee nahi padti. Abhi gaye maheene TV bhej dee... Chirag and Munna look at the LCD tv kept there.  128 67.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...thodi patli hai par dikhta bahut badhiya hai (looks up) phir je pankha bhej diya, teen hee pe sanna deta hai.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: (cutting her) Hai kahaan aajkal aunty?

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Apne Lucknow mein. Kaaju khaaoge? Hum toh roj khaate hain. Both just look at her.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. RAILWAY PLATFORM — DAY 128 Chirag is standing outside the train. Bitti is standing next to him.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Kyu?

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Hamaare liye itta kar rahe ho. Chirag just smiles. Bitti keeps on looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kyu kar rahe ho? Gentle music. Both are looking at each other. Chirag is about to say something just then the train honks. Chirag lets out a faint smile. Munna appears inside the train window.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Chadh jaao bhaiya ticket tumhaare hee paas hai. Train starts to move. Chirag turns to Bitti.  129 68.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Chalte hain. Bitti shakes her head in a no and corrects him.

dialogues.speaker: BITTI
dialogues.text: Tch... milte hain.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: (smiles) Milte hain. Train has moved a bit. Munna is screaming from the window.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Arre bhaiya nikal lee gaadi!!! Chirag hops on to the train. Bitti stands there and watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chirag is looking outside the window. Munna is hogging on the tiffin food.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Bhaiya puri bhaji toh bahut jabar banaai hai bhabhi ne.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Mangloo ki dukaan ki hain. Bitti ko khaana banaana nahi aata. Munna looks at him as he licks his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Nnnnnnahi nahi!

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Laga le sau sau ki.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Rang chadh gaya hai bhabhi ka. Munna then picks up a chilli pickle and looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidrohi ko laana zaroori hai kya? Do din Lucknow ghoomenge aur waapas aake bol denge ki nahi mila.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Nahi yaar, uske sar pe Vidrohi ka bhoot sawaar hai. Toh milwaana toh padega. Ek baar mil le toh tantaa khatam. 69. Munna takes a bite from the achaar and likes it.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Aur pasand aa gaya toh? Bada aadmi bann gaya hai.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: (confident smile) Nahi aayega.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Train crosses in full speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot of Lucknow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the outside wide shot of BMW showroom.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Ab Vidrohi ki ma ki nazron se dekha jaaye toh wohh itne bada aadmi hain...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 133 Vidrohi, dressed in impeccable formals, is showing a car to a rich couple.  134 70.

dialogues.speaker: VIDROHI
dialogues.text: (polished accent) And that’s not all sir. This 400 BHP beast comes with 8 air bags, traction control, ABS and electronic immobilizers. And if you ask me maa’m, Monaco blue would suit you. Chirag and Munna are standing outside the showroom, looking at Vidrohi, awestruck. Vidrohi turns to the manager and screams.

dialogues.speaker: VIDROHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Haan beta blue waali gaadi baandh de!!! Chirag and Munna look surprised. They exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR
dialogues.text: Par hakeekat toh... ye hai. Chirag and Munna turn back and look at Vidrohi again.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. SARI SHOWROOM
dialogues.text: Vidrohi is screaming at a boy in the sari shop.

dialogues.speaker: VIDROHI
dialogues.text: Haan beta blue wali sari baandh de. Chirag and Munna are watching him from a distance. Vidrohi now turns to two female customers, with a sari partly wrapped around his waist. He talks as he makes pleats with a sari.

dialogues.speaker: VIDROHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bhabhi ji ye dekhiye, saamne bhi na teen color ki fading hai isme, aur ye pallu dekhiye... Puts the pallu, turns and shows.  71.

dialogues.speaker: VIDROHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... itna bhaari kaam poori sari mein nahi milta jitna pallu mein kiya hai. Teen din lag jaate hai ek piece mein. Chirag and Munna standing at a distance can’t believe their eyes. Then they burst out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Dekh sales manager pallu sambhal raha hai.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: Shaadi mubarak ho bhaiya. Both shake hands. We go back to Vidrohi. He takes off the sari and throws it at an attendant.

dialogues.speaker: VIDROHI
dialogues.text: Beta isko thaili mein daal de (turns to women) phir aaiyega bhabhiji. The women move away and Vidrohi turns and starts folding the saris he has shown to the women. Chirag and Munna quietly go and sit on the chairs opposite Vidrohi who is engrossed in folding the saris.

dialogues.speaker: MUNNA
dialogues.text: (girl's voice) Bhaiya Chanderi mein kuch hai??? Vidrohi turns immediately.

dialogues.speaker: VIDROHI
dialogues.text: Hain na bhaa... He freezes on seeing Chirag and Munna.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Kya Pritam Pyaare, sari utaarne ki umar mein pehna rahe ho.

dialogues.speaker: VIDROHI
dialogues.text: Aap log yahaan? Kyu? Kaise?  135 136 72.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Chai pila, bataate hain.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. TEA STALL — DAY CONTINUOUS 135 They are sipping tea.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Toh tu nahi chalega? Vidrohi shakes his head in a no.

dialogues.speaker: VIDROHI
dialogues.text: Nahi bhaiya, aapke chakkar mein hamaari degree chhoot gayi, hamaara shahar chhot gaya, ab naukri hum katai na chhod paayenge. Vidrohi’s boss calls out for him.

dialogues.speaker: BOSS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ai Vidrohi, customer tumra baap sambhalega kya be? Vidrohi gulps down his tea in a flash and keeps the glass on the bench with a thud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vidrohi is back to his place, picking up a sari, looking in his boss’s direction who is looking back at him. Chirag and Munna are sitting opposite him.

dialogues.speaker: VIDROHI
dialogues.text: Haan bhaiya chanderi mein toh bahut varity hain. Boss now getting a massage sleeping on the gaddha, convinced, looks other way to sleep. Vidrohi continues to do pleats and puts pallu around as he talks to Chirag and Munna.  73.

dialogues.speaker: VIDROHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kahaa na bhaiya, nahi aa paayenge.

dialogues.speaker: CHIRAG
dialogues.text: Dekh yaar paanch saal baad kisi ladki pe dil aaya hai. Lekin woh chahti hai Bareliy ki barfi ke writer ko, jo ki kitaab ke hisaab se tum ho.

dialogues.speaker: VIDROHI
